clues: Home to a giant clock tower that isn’t actually called Big Ben.
Features a historic palace where the monarch resides.
fun_fact: The London Underground is the oldest metro system in the world.
Red double-decker buses were introduced in 1956.
trivia: The River Thames has over 200 bridges.
Buckingham Palace has over 700 rooms.

clues: An ancient city known for its gladiatorial arena.
Built on seven hills and home to the Vatican.
fun_fact: Has a country within the city—the Vatican, the smallest country in the world.
Trevi Fountain collects over $1 million in coins annually, which is donated to charity.
trivia: Has more than 900 churches.
The Colosseum once held naval battles by filling it with water.

clues: Home to the tallest building in the world.
Features an artificial archipelago shaped like a palm tree.
fun_fact: Has an indoor ski resort in the middle of the desert.
The police force includes luxury cars like Lamborghinis and Ferraris.
trivia: The Burj Khalifa is so tall that you can watch the sunset twice—once from the ground and again from the top.
ATMs here dispense gold bars.

clues: Known for tango dancing and vibrant nightlife.
The widest avenue in the world runs through this city.
fun_fact: Home to one of the most beautiful bookstores in the world, El Ateneo Grand Splendid.
The city has the most bookstores per capita in the world.
trivia: The Obelisk is one of the most iconic landmarks.
The name means 'Fair Winds' in Spanish.

clues: Features a flat-topped mountain offering stunning views.
Home to a prison where Nelson Mandela was once held.
fun_fact: One of the only places in the world where you can see penguins on the beach.
Robben Island is a UNESCO World Heritage Site.
trivia: Table Mountain has more plant species than the entire UK.
The city was the first in South Africa to host the FIFA World Cup.

clues: Home to a famous unfinished basilica.
Hosted the 1992 Summer Olympics.
fun_fact: The city was planned with octagonal blocks for better airflow.
Gaudi's Sagrada Familia is still under construction.
trivia: Has more than 20 Michelin-starred restaurants.
Park Güell was originally meant to be a housing development.

clues: Capital of K-pop and modern technology.
Has one of the fastest internet speeds in the world.
fun_fact: The city blends ancient palaces with futuristic skyscrapers.
Kimchi is a staple food here.
trivia: Hosts a lantern festival every year.
Gangnam district became famous worldwide due to a viral song.

clues: Built on top of a former Aztec capital.
Sinks several inches each year due to its soft ground.
fun_fact: Has the most museums in the world after London and Paris.
The largest plaza in Latin America is here.
trivia: Chocolate originated from ancient Mesoamerican cultures here.
It was once known as Tenochtitlán.

clues: Home to a famous unfinished basilica.
Hosted the 1992 Summer Olympics.
fun_fact: The city was planned with octagonal blocks for better airflow.
Gaudi's Sagrada Familia is still under construction.
trivia: Has more than 20 Michelin-starred restaurants.
Park Güell was originally meant to be a housing development.

clues: Capital of K-pop and modern technology.
Has one of the fastest internet speeds in the world.
fun_fact: The city blends ancient palaces with futuristic skyscrapers.
Kimchi is a staple food here.
trivia: Hosts a lantern festival every year.
Gangnam district became famous worldwide due to a viral song.

clues: Built on top of a former Aztec capital.
Sinks several inches each year due to its soft ground.
fun_fact: Has the most museums in the world after London and Paris.
The largest plaza in Latin America is here.
